body.p:
To his excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Hopkins & adjoining counties who have heretofore Known Thos B Wadlington who has been convicted by a Jury of the country in the county of Caldwell of the crime of murder would represent to your excelency that we have known the unfortunate man and that his character as a gentleman a true hearted & loyal citizen of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, has never been questioned

It is true that we know nothing of the circumstances of his case, but we feel that we do not depart from the duty that we owe to humanity and to the previous character of the accused as a man of peace industry and sobriety to ask your honor to review his case and to exercise the powers that are confered upoun you to Suspend or modify the rules of Strict law and to either extend to the accused a full pardon or a commutation of his punishment as Justice tempered with mercy in your opinion may require

Yours respectfully
Edward Burgess
